intro: Navarretia stenothyrsa, commonly known as the narrowleaf navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its small, white to pinkish flowers bloom in spring, and the leaves are narrow and lance-shaped. Navarretia stenothyrsa is often found in coastal and inland areas, showing adaptability to various soil types.
